metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Gortash in his office.Possible outcomes:1. You visited Steel Foundry and the destroyed Control Centre - he attacks you.2. You visited Steel Foundry, didn't destroy the Control Centre, but someone activated Dead Man switch which destroyed Iron T hrone. He attacks you.3. You visited Iron Throne which caused the destruction of it. He tells you - "I warned you" and then attacks you.4. You didn't kill Orin.5. You killed Orin and you have both Netherstones.6. Fallback node which includes the case where you killed Orin, but didn't bring either of the netherstones.

44.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
44.text: Yet you've returned without Orin's. This was not the agreement.

103.speaker: Karlach
103.text: I don't give a shit about your agreement.

5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
5.text: Then why in the Nine Hells have you come back here, Karlach? What could you possibly want?!

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: How about an apology for sending me to the Hells?
33.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

157.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
157.text: Sorry?! You want me to be sorry for helping you gain more power than you've ever known?
157.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

84.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
84.text: That thing in your chest is a blessing I helped you receive. One you're too much of a fool to see.
84.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

109.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
109.text: I gave you a clean slate. A chance to rejoin me for our mutual benefit - again.
109.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

12.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
12.text: Yet you snubbed my warning and brought my Iron Throne to ruin.
12.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

77.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
77.text: The brain awakens. It's time I take matters into my own hands.

216.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
216.text: We could have moved mountains, we could have shaken the planes. And you chose imperfection.

54.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
54.text: Yet you sowed chaos at my Iron Throne. You blatantly mocked the terms of my bargain.
54.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

115.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
115.text: Yet you struck my Steel Watch. You blatantly mocked the terms of my bargain.
115.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

158.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
158.text: Yet Orin still lives, still holds her stone. You blatantly mock the terms of my bargain.
158.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: From you? I guess nothing. Not anymore.

127.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
127.text: I had high hopes for you. Ones you've dashed to pieces - again.

217.speaker: Karlach
217.text: However little I think of you, you always manage to find a way to make me hate you even more.

183.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
183.text: Enough of the dramatics. You're nursing a wound long-healed. We had the chance to  do something truly incredible here. Now. Not a short lifetime ago.

160.speaker: Karlach
160.text: I'm working on it - but not for your benefit.

36.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
36.text: You're 'working on it' are you? You used your time to break our agreement and bring my Iron Throne to ruin.

34.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
34.text: And what is it you're working on, hmm? Seeding chaos upon my Iron Throne? Defying our agreement?

202.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
202.text: Why in the Nine Hells have you come back here, Karlach? What could you possibly want, after what you've done?!

108.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
108.text: That much is clear. You've stricken out at my Steel Watch for reasons that are utterly incomprehensible.

165.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
165.text: You're 'working on it' are you? And what do you have to show for yourself? Nothing!

32.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
32.text: Why in the Nine Hells have you come back here, Karlach? What could you possibly want?

151.speaker: Karlach
151.text: Give me time. Our lord wills it.

47.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
47.text: You betrayed our lord by ignoring his Chosen. I speak; you obey.

72.speaker: Karlach
72.text: Turns out I don't want to play your little game. I've had enough of those to last a lifetime.

50.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
50.text: Have you come to dredge up an ancient grudge, Karlach? Now? When so much hangs in the balance?

141.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
141.text: Karlach. You've no resonance about you at all. No Netherstones - not even Ketheric Thorm's.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his arm, showing his gauntlet. The Netherstone in it does not gleam, but remains as it is. He lowers his arms.

223.text: Karlach. You've no resonance about you at all. No Netherstones - not even Ketheric Thorm's.
223.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his arm, showing his gauntlet. The Netherstone in it does not gleam, but remains as it is. He lowers his arms.

35.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
35.text: Karlach. You've no resonance about you at all. No Netherstones - not even Ketheric Thorm's.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his arm, showing his gauntlet. The Netherstone in it gleams. He lowers his arms. Then only he speaks the line... [Choices]

40.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
40.text: We will meet under the city and take control of the brain. Then we will take our rightful place as its rulers.
40.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

96.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
96.text: Dearest Karlach. I'd busy myself finding Orin if I were you. I'll still be here for any unfinished business, once you've secured your camp.
96.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

162.speaker: Karlach
162.text: That's it? That's all you have to say to me?
162.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

46.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
46.text: Were you hoping for something else? A word of wisdom? A hug?
46.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: Thanks to you, I don't hope for things anymore. I just take whatever it is I want.
43.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

80.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
80.text: You want to kill Orin and retrieve the stone. Trust me.
80.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: Trust you? That's a good one; tell another.
59.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

142.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
142.text: I can't change the past - and I'm not even sure I would if I could. Look what you've become: An impressive power in your own right.

218.speaker: Karlach
218.text: I'm not a naive kid anymore. And I don't take orders from you.
218.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

68.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
68.text: Consider it an invitation then. For you to save your own life before it's too late.
68.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

107.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
107.text: I'm proud of you, Karlach. Proud of what you've accomplished. And I look forward to working together as allies - equals - from this moment on.
107.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

10.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
10.text: Do not squander this opportunity. It may be the last one you get.
10.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

199.speaker: Karlach
199.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

51.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
51.context: NodeContext: Hostile, but not combat - just shooing her away.

119.speaker: Karlach
119.text: You better follow through on your end of the deal.

17.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
17.text: You can count on me, Karlach. I promise.

159.speaker: Karlach
159.text: Don't patronise me. Not after everything you've done.

181.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
181.text: Then stop acting like a child. The past is done, Karlach. Never to return again. And the present is bearing down on our necks like a hobnailed boot.

65.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
65.text: Trust me that your best chance of survival is to kill Orin and retrieve the stone.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: I'll be back, motherfucker. See you soon.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.text: You ought to be worried about your own hide.
49.context: NodeContext: Ready to fight. Staying cool, but a hint of villainy

52.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
52.text: One benefit of becoming the Archduke of Baldur's Gate is that you have a whole legion of soldiers to worry about that for you.

70.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
70.text: Unless you want to provoke them, my dear, I suggest you hurry on your way.

210.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
210.text: Your time in the Hells has taught you nothing. You remain the same impulsive little brute you've always been. I haven't missed you at all, you know - and I won't miss you when you're dead, either.

152.speaker: Karlach
152.text: You're mistaken. I'd like to finish our business now.
152.context: NodeContext: Ready to fight. Staying cool, but a hint of villainy

191.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
191.text: Orin is in your camp as we speak, committing who knows what unspeakable horrors. Whatever festering grudge you bear toward me is of little importance by comparison.
191.context: NodeContext: Ready to fight. Staying cool, but a hint of villainy

182.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
182.text: I'm sure even you can appreciate that.

100.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
100.text: I warned you, Karlach. You could have walked away. But you hunger for petty vengeance won out, didn't it?
100.context: NodeContext: Furious - a threat. Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

174.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
174.text: I warned you, Karlach. You could have walked away. But you hunger for petty vengeance won out, didn't it?
174.context: NodeContext: Furious - a threat. Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

145.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
145.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Iron Throne. Whatever alliance we might have made fell with it.
145.context: NodeContext: Furious - a threat. Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

209.speaker: Karlach
209.text: God, it's good to watch you suffer.
209.context: NodeContext: Furious - a threat. Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

149.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
149.text: You don't know the meaning of the word!
149.context: NodeContext: Furious - a threat. Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

178.speaker: Karlach
178.text: I trusted you once. I was so naive, and you took advantage of that.

89.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
89.text: 'Took advantage.' Like you were some waif without a will of her own? You threw your lot in with mine. Willingly. Whatever came next falls at your feet, Karlach.

173.speaker: Karlach
173.text: You live in a fantasy world. One where everyone is to blame but yourself.

201.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
201.text: I don't care about blame. I care about progress. I care about power. That is why you are a servant and I am a master.

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: I was young. You should have been my mentor, not my betrayer.

208.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
208.text: You knew what I was. Yet you were fool enough to think the rules didn't apply to you.

146.speaker: Karlach
146.text: The only thing that's about to fall at my feet is you.

138.speaker: Karlach
138.text: Thanks to you, I endured more suffering than you could begin to fathom.

98.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
98.text: Please. That thing in your chest made you more powerful than you could ever have dreamed of. I conspired to  give you a gift, and you're furious about it.

76.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
76.text: If you can't seize power when it's given to you, then you're destined to live as a servant. I do not suffer the same affliction.

177.speaker: Karlach
177.text: It's over for you, Gortash. Take one last look at me, cause I'm the last thing you'll ever see.

74.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
74.text: Listen to yourself, Karlach! Blind to every opportunity.

128.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
128.text: That thing in your chest made you more powerful than you could ever have dreamed of. I conspired to  give you a gift, and you're furious about it.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: I did what I had to. I have no regrets.
73.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

143.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
143.text: Not yet. But you will, when I'm done with you.
143.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: An alliance? You must be joking.

130.speaker: Karlach
130.text: Bane wills us to work together.

28.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
28.text: You betrayed our lord by ignoring his Chosen. You always were a fool.

105.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
105.text: Well, well well! I was certain you'd scupper our alliance in service of an ancient, petty grudge. You've surprised me.
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters Gortash's room, and Gortash smiles wide.

13.text: Well, well well! I was certain you'd scupper our alliance in service of an ancient, petty grudge. You've surprised me.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player enters Gortash's room, and Gortash smiles wide.

78.text: Well, well well! I was certain you'd scupper our alliance in service of an ancient, petty grudge. You've surprised me.
78.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his arm, showing his gauntlet. The Netherstone in it gleams. He lowers his arms.

81.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
81.text: Well, well well! I was certain you'd scupper our alliance in service of an ancient, petty grudge. You've surprised me.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his arm, showing his gauntlet. The Netherstone in it gleams. He lowers his arms. Then only he speaks the line... [Choices]

166.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
166.text: You've killed Orin - and brought me two Netherstones. It is time, my dear. Time to become what we were meant to be.
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room shakes from a "brainquake".

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: How can I trust you now, Gortash? After everything you did to me?
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room shakes from a "brainquake".

19.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
19.text: I helped you realise your potential. Look at you now, Karlach. You stand at the precipice of a new era.
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room shakes from a "brainquake".

0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
0.text: Do not allow some silly, bitter complaint to taint that.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room shakes from a "brainquake".

15.text: The brain awakens - we must act now. Faithful, come forward.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room shakes from a "brainquake".

171.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
171.text: The brain awakens - we must act now. Faithful, come forward.
171.context: CinematicNodeContext: Several Banites step from the corner shadows, one at a time. They look fierce and dangerous.

169.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
169.text: Hand me the Netherstones and we will rule as one - our Lord Bane commands it.
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Several Banites step from the corner shadows, one at a time. They look fierce and dangerous.

26.text: Hand me the Netherstones and we will rule as one - our Lord Bane commands it.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Several Banites step from the corner shadows, one at a time. They look fierce and dangerous.

14.text: Hand me the Netherstones and we will rule as one - our Lord Bane commands it.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finally, the Steel Watcher stepw forward. It activates, looking devastatingly powerful.

224.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
224.text: Hand me the Netherstones, and we will rule as one.

48.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
48.text: Kill him and take his stone. The Grand Design cannot come to pass.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: Kill him and take his stone. The Grand Design cannot come to pass.

175.speaker: Shadowheart
175.text: I've met venomous snakes I'd be faster to trust. Are you sure about this?

200.speaker: Astarion
200.text: Maybe it's just me, but I don't trust someone who worships the god of tyranny to share his power.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: Do what he asks. My father's life is in his hands.

196.speaker: Gale
196.text: Are you sure we should be trusting him?

222.speaker: Halsin
222.text: Surely none but a boiled turnip would trust the likes of him.

2.speaker: Jaheira
2.text: That is the royal 'we', I think. Little men do not like to share power.

120.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
120.text: Take the Netherstones. I deserve the power you promised - even if I have to share it with the likes of you.
120.context: NodeContext: Genuine disappointment. This is a major turning point cause we are giving him what he asked for - but it was a test. He wanted us to resist.

95.speaker: Karlach
95.text: Take the Netherstones. I deserve the power you promised - even if I have to share it with the likes of you.
95.context: NodeContext: Genuine disappointment. This is a major turning point cause we are giving him what he asked for - but it was a test. He wanted us to resist.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: Take the Netherstone. I deserve the power you promised - even if I have to share it with the likes of you.
93.context: NodeContext: Genuine disappointment. This is a major turning point cause we are giving him what he asked for - but it was a test. He wanted us to resist.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: Take the Netherstone. I deserve the power you promised - even if I have to share it with the likes of you.
60.context: NodeContext: Genuine disappointment. This is a major turning point cause we are giving him what he asked for - but it was a test. He wanted us to resist.

97.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
97.context: NodeContext: Genuine disappointment. This is a major turning point cause we are giving him what he asked for - but it was a test. He wanted us to resist.

69.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
69.text: I'd hoped  that, by now, you'd manage to demonstrate a little more gravitas. A little leadership.

192.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
192.text: Truthfully, I have no need for an ally who gives away her power at the first ask. I have enough underlings. I want an equal.

135.speaker: Karlach
135.text: I don't have them on me. Give me a little time to retrieve them, and they're yours.
135.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

212.speaker: Karlach
212.text: I'm not giving you anything. If we'll both rule, we can each keep our stones.
212.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

75.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
75.text: Give me the stone now, Karlach, or face the black hand of Lord Bane.
75.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

106.speaker: Karlach
106.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

190.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
190.text: How like you, Karlach. You give in with the slightest bit of pressure.

153.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
153.text: You're a disappointment. Again. I've no use for such a weak ally.

39.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
39.text: I think I'll take that second horn of yours and use it as a goblet.

45.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
45.text: Wouldn't that be fitting? A servant even past your dying day.

172.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
172.text: Good-bye Karlach. I didn't miss you before, and I won't miss you now.

213.speaker: Karlach
213.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

134.speaker: Karlach
134.text: I don't have them on me. Give me a little time to retrieve them, and they're yours.
134.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

150.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
150.text: Yes! That's the spirit, my dear! Not so long ago you did as you were told, no questions asked.
150.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

189.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
189.text: Your time in the Hells has toughened you up. Made a worthy partner out of you.

111.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
111.text: Our time is short. The elder brain is held beneath the city. We must go to it if we're to control it.

167.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
167.text: There is a vessel to the Morphic Pool, where the brain feeds. I will wait for you there.

63.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
63.text: With the Netherstones in hand, the brain can't resist us. We will be Absolute, with an infected army at our beck and call.

23.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
23.text: First, we take Baldur's Gate, then Faerûn. All of Toril will soon follow. A thousand kingdoms, at our command.

155.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
155.text: It was always meant to be like this, Karlach. You and I, ruling side by side. Let a new dawn begin.

113.speaker: Karlach
113.text: Study Gortash. What are his intentions?

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *You spot the hint of a smile. He is testing you - he wants you to refuse.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *You spot the hint of a smile. He is testing you - he wants you to refuse.*

122.text: *There is no telling what schemes Gortash could be planning.*

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *There is no telling what schemes Gortash could be planning.*

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: Study Gortash again. What more can you glean?

121.speaker: Narrator
121.text: *Gortash studies you carefully in turn. He is shrewd and headstrong, and he expects the same of you.*

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Gortash studies you carefully in turn. He is shrewd and headstrong, and he expects the same of you.*

140.speaker: Narrator
140.text: I hope this girl has grown a backbone. Otherwise, I'll have to send her back where she came from.

29.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
29.text: I hope this girl has grown a backbone. Otherwise, I'll have to send her back where she came from.

133.speaker: Narrator
133.text: Prove your worth, Karlach. Do not buckle at the slightest pressure. Go on. Refuse me.

102.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
102.text: Prove your worth, Karlach. Do not buckle at the slightest pressure. Go on. Refuse me.

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: Study Gortash. We can't trust this prick, can we?

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Dream on, Gortash. You're dead. Just like me, but sooner.

88.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
88.text: You child. You imprudent wretch. I always knew you were good for nothing - that's why I gave you to Zariel without a second thought.

219.speaker: Minsc
219.text: The only thing I will hand you is my fist, tyrant. And there will be a sword in it.
219.context: NodeContext: First line delivered as if it's a snappy comeback. Second line is a necessary amendment in case his meaning wasn' t clear

25.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
25.text: Relinquishing the stone to him makes us servants, not allies. We should keep what we have earned.

221.speaker: Karlach
221.text: I am who I'm meant to be. You have nothing to do with it.

203.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
203.text: On the contrary. I made you. That thing in your heart has made you more powerful than you had any right to be. You're welcome.

3.speaker: Karlach
3.text: This thing in my chest is killing me, you know. You did that.

101.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
101.text: And now I'm giving you the power to become as a god - a ruler of the realm.

117.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
117.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Steel Watch. Whatever bargain we might have made fell with it.
117.context: NodeContext: A bit psycho; mock friendliness like 'not if I see you first' but perverted

184.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
184.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Steel Watch. Whatever bargain we might have made fell with it.

137.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
137.text: Karlach. I was wondering when you'd come.
137.context: NodeContext: A bit psycho; mock friendliness like 'not if I see you first' but perverted

110.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
110.text: Karlach. I was wondering when you'd come.

27.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
27.text: I didn't enjoy watching you make a mess of our plans. It pains me to witness your potential wasted - again.

170.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
170.text: A lackey once more, hey, Karlach? Pitiful. Bring your leader if you wish to speak to me. I don't waste time on flunkeys.
170.context: NodeContext: A bit psycho; mock friendliness like 'not if I see you first' but perverted

112.speaker: Karlach
112.text: Gods, I can't wait to kill you.
112.context: NodeContext: A bit psycho; mock friendliness like 'not if I see you first' but perverted

154.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
154.text: Not if I kill you first.
154.context: NodeContext: A bit psycho; mock friendliness like 'not if I see you first' but perverted

179.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
179.text: You have work to do, my dear.

180.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
180.text: Karlach. I was wondering when you'd come.

8.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
8.text: Karlach. I was wondering when you'd come.

116.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
116.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Iron Throne. Whatever bargain we might have made fell with it.
